title: 3 takeaways from Team USA men’s hockey’s OT win over Sweden in Olympics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Quinn Hughes scored the overtime winner for Team USA, defeating Sweden 2-1 in the 2026 Winter Olympics men's hockey quarterfinal.
Team USA progresses to the semifinals to face Slovakia, while Team Canada will play Finland in the other semifinal matchup.
Four Bruins players remain in the gold medal race, with Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman on Team USA and two others on Team Finland.

title: Pittsfield armored vehicle company is largest ICE contract in Mass.
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Lenco Industries in Pittsfield has the largest ICE contract in Massachusetts, valued at $5.2 million over the past year.
Governor Maura Healey criticizes state resources supporting ICE but hasn't commented on the local contract with Lenco Industries.
Lenco also produces vehicles for fire departments and military, rejecting a $10 million contract from ICE to diversify clientele.

title: Former State Police union head, lobbyist get more prison time for fraud, racketeering
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Former Mass. State Police union head Dana Pullman sentenced to 2 years for racketeering, fraud, and tax crimes.
Ex-union lobbyist Anne Lynch sentenced to 15 months for wire fraud, obstruction of justice, and tax offenses.
Both defendants ordered to pay restitution; convictions involved misuse of union funds and false tax filings.

title: Boston 25 News head meteorologist Kevin Lemanowicz departing after 3 decades with the station
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Kevin Lemanowicz is stepping down as chief meteorologist at Boston 25 News after nearly 30 years on February 27.
Lemanowicz joined Boston 25 News at its inception in 1996 and covered major weather events like the 2011 tornadoes and 2015 snowstorms.
Vice President Todd Brown praised Lemanowicz's commitment to excellence and his lasting connection with New England viewers.

title: Red Sox release statement after outcry over flawed jersey design
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Red Sox acknowledged design flaws in their 2026 home jerseys, with 'RED' and 'SOX' overlapping red stripes.
The team stated adjustments to the jerseys will be made with MLB and Fanatics, ready for Opening Day.
The initial design was approved by the Red Sox, who clarified that Fanatics followed their specifications.

title: Pawtucket police find firearms in ice rink shooter’s storage locker, identify ‘courageous citizens’ who intervened
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Robert Dorgan, 56, killed his ex-wife and son at a Pawtucket ice rink over a family dispute.
Police found firearms, ammunition, and accessories in Dorgan's Brunswick, Maine, storage unit.
Bystanders Michael Black, Robert Rattenni, and Ryan Cordeiro subdued Dorgan, preventing further injuries.

title: MBTA announces service changes and suspensions for March
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: MBTA announces weekend suspensions for Orange Line and four Commuter Rail lines in March for signal upgrades.
Orange Line service from Back Bay to Forest Hills halted Feb. 28-Mar. 8; free shuttles available.
Fitchburg, Haverhill, Lowell, and Newburyport/Rockport lines suspended for signal system improvements.

title: Rafael Devers reacts to Red Sox exec’s ‘pick up a glove’ comment
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers was traded to the San Francisco Giants by the Boston Red Sox in June 2025.
Red Sox chairman Tom Werner criticized Devers for refusing to play first base after an injury to Triston Casas.
Devers responded to Werner's comments by saying he wants to move on and focus on his future with the Giants.

title: Adam Schefter maps out potential price for Patriots in Maxx Crosby trade
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Adam Schefter reports the Raiders may request a Micah Parsons-type package for Maxx Crosby in trade considerations.
Crosby's relationship with the Raiders is strained due to December injury management and involvement of Alex Guerrero.
The Patriots, struggling with only 35 sacks last season, may consider trading their 2026 first-round pick for Crosby.

title: Fleet’s Aerin Frankel, Team USA ready for yet another gold-medal showdown against Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Aerin Frankel has allowed only one goal on 68 shots, leading Team USA to the 2026 Olympic gold-medal game.
Team USA and Canada will face off for the seventh Olympic gold since 1998, with Canada leading 5-2 in victories.
Team USA beat Canada 5-0 in earlier Olympic play, marking Canada's first-ever Olympic shutout loss.
